Authors:
Hong-Bo Jiang, Kevin D. Hyde, Pattana Kakumyan, Ali H.
Bahkali, Abdallah M Elgorban, Er-Fu Yang, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Saisamorn
Lumyong
Title:
Morphological and multi-gene phylogenetic appraisal of
Ophioceras (Ophioceraceae, Magnaporthales)
Keywords:
1 novel taxon, 2 new combinations, bambusicolous fungi,
Ceratosphaerella, Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
Ophioceraceae comprises a single genus, Ophioceras,
characterized by immersed to superficial, subglobose, black, uni- to
multi-loculate ascomata or pseudostromata, with long cylindrical necks,
8-spored, unitunicate, subcylindrical to clavate asci with a small,
refractive, J- apical ring, and filiform or narrowly fusiform, hyaline
to olivaceous or pale brown ascospores. In this study, we introduce a
novel species viz.Â Ophioceras sichuanense based on morphological
comparison coupled with multi-gene phylogenetic analyses. The species
forms a distinct lineage basal to Ophioceras with high statistic
supports (98% ML, 1.00 PP). Ophioceras sichuanense occurs on submerged
decaying branches of bamboo in Sichuan, China. Ceratosphaerella
castillensis and C. rhizomorpha form a subclade within Ophioceras and
therefore, Ceratosphaerella is synonymized under Ophioceras. The
phylogenetic relationships of Ophioceras are discussed in relation to
morphological similarities of genera in Magnaporthales. An updated
phylogenetic tree of Magnaporthales is provided.
